Dating: 18TH DYNASTY (not before); NEW KINGDOM; 20TH DYNASTY (not after)
Name: Bottle with a handle
Description: This receptacle of terracotta comes from the excavations of the Egypt Exploration fund at Abydos in 1912-1913. Its specific form probably demonstrates that it is of Near-Eastern import. The bottle, which is often found represented in  Theban tomb scenes, was used as a ewer.
